newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss bond market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Swiss bond market closing report.

text.p: Swiss bonds ended a quiet low-volume day firmer, with EuroSwiss futures moving higher relative to the long end.
In Switzerland, the Swiss National Bank (SNB) continued to be generous in the money market, traders said.

Swiss bonds gained less than Bunds, buoyed by latest speculation the Bundesbank may wait with any rate increase. Some market participants had been nervous about prospects for a German rate rise at its meeting on Thursday. Markets were also waiting for the U.S. Federal Open Market Committee meeting to end. Most traders did not expect a U.S. tightening, either.
Euro Swiss francs up four at 98.46.
